str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Quickly, speedily. Neuter singular of tachus; shortly, i.e. Without delay, soon, or suddenly, or readily.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To bring out, carry out, sometimes out of the city for burial; I bring forth, bear, produce. From ek and phero; to bear out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
A long robe, worn by the upper classes in the East. From stello; equipment, i.e., a 'stole' or long-fitting gown.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
A finger-ring. From daktulos; a finger-ring.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A hand.
And, even, also, namely.
A sandal; anything bound under. From hupodeo; something bound under the feet, i.e. A shoe or sandal.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
